comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Another forgotten scandal of 1915: Mrs. Ruth Taylor Conlin and young Donald Clapham (both were under 21) were accused of breaking into closed cottages in Sea Cliff, Long Island, and robbing them, mostly for the adventure. Mrs. Conlin was a society "belle," and Clapham was her tango partner. chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1915-06-19/ed-... news.google.com/newspapers?id=vEQdAAAAIBAJ&sjid=NkkEA... Mrs. Conlin had eloped as a teenager with a chauffeur (a la Downton Abbey!); the marriage did not last long, but the Conlins were not yet legally divorced during Ruth and Donald's spree.
